displayName.text: Project Renewal Third Street Men's Shelter

formattedAddress: 8 E 3rd St #8908, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 8 E 3rd St #8908, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: Working here has been nothing but pure hell. The work environment is completely TOXIC!!! No empathy or compassion shown to staff members, if they make a mistake.they knitpick at you, use people like scapegoats and still expect you to come to work smiling and being fake and phony as they are. Your words falls on deaf ears when you tell the bosses. Bosses will choose SIDES. They are extremely manipulative, gaslight you and have narcissistic tendencies when you hold them accountable for how they treat you. Its like your in jail, serving hard time.  This is NOT a safe space at all. Please, save yourself and peace of mind and work somewhere that values your worth, time and energy. This place aint it at all. People come in and out like a revolving door. Truly sad the many atrocities that i put up with being at this place. They lack proper etiquette, morals and a conscience. They thrive off of gossip, trauma and chaos.

originalText.text: My friend has been there almost 8 months and he’s moving out soon. He tells me all the time how great the staff is and that they helped him realize he can still become something in life. he would tell me about his recreation specialist i think her name is Lisa and how she will stop whatever she’s doing to help him and how much it means to him because he was ready to give up but the staff there are literally life savers and they don’t even know it. Thank you all at 3rd street shelter!!!

originalText.text: When I came to that shelter I was put on the worst floor. The 6th floor where men are drinking ingredients alchol and smoking cigarettes.  Then I wass transferred down to the third floor whi ch is supposed  to be the medical floor and my stuff was stolen my winter jack and my nebulizer zero which I'm a severe asthmatic.  Project renewell staff told me that there was a coat drive a couple blocks away which it was a lue. The staff at project renewal was nasty except the medical staff. Dr.vordurum and Dr Hanna and William the the suboxone Dnurse practices was very nice.

originalText.text: It's not that I don't like the place, it's the clinical staff doesn't like there job. Security is so/so & operations (yellow shirts) are pretty decent but as I said ; the clinical staff is not working for the improvement or advancement of any clients.

originalText.text: Alot of favoritism and people only get promoted based on conflict of interest and who you know, who you blow basis. Not because they are skilled and professionalism is out the window. Worked as a Residential Aid at the East Williamsburg location, Run DO NOT work here. Very ghetto.
